term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - fog horizon in atmospheric chemistry
term.title: fog horizon

item.text: The top of a fog layer which is confined by a low-level temperature inversion and gives the appearance of the horizon (which it actually obscures) when viewed from above, against the sky.

sources.item: PAC, 1990, 62, 2167. 'Glossary of atmospheric chemistry terms (Recommendations 1990)' on page 2190 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199062112167)
